ranges.notes: Public holiday, most businesses closed, recovery from New Year's Eve celebrations, winter atmosphere at Grote Markt
Winter sales begin, cold weather, few tourists, good time for museum visits like Frans Hals Museum and Teylers Museum
Cold winter weather continues, few tourists, excellent time for museums and indoor attractions
Special menus at canal-side restaurants, romantic experiences at historic venues
Free cultural programming throughout the city center with winter-themed performances and exhibitions
Early spring with unpredictable weather, gradual warming, indoor-outdoor activities at covered venues like Philharmonie Haarlem
New exhibitions opening at Frans Hals Museum and De Hallen, early spring flowers in city parks
Easter markets at Grote Markt, extended shopping hours, special brunches at restaurants across the city
Famous flower parade from Noordwijk to Haarlem with elaborate floats made of spring flowers
Spring weather improves, tulips and spring flowers throughout city parks and botanical gardens, outdoor café culture begins
One of the Netherlands' most vibrant King's Day celebrations with canal-based festivities, citywide free markets (vrijmarkt), orange-themed parties
Beautiful spring conditions, perfect for visiting Haarlemmer Kweektuin gardens and exploring the canals
Public holiday with demonstrations and events in the city center
May 4th (Remembrance Day) and May 5th (Liberation Day) commemorate WWII with ceremonies at historical sites
Perfect spring conditions, flowering trees throughout the canals, excellent time for boat tours and outdoor dining
Early summer weather, excellent for outdoor activities, canal-side dining, and exploration of the historic center
Food festival on the Grote Markt featuring local restaurants and culinary specialties
Various cultural events throughout the month including outdoor concerts, theater performances, and art exhibitions
Peak summer weather, outdoor activities very popular at city beaches along the Spaarne River
Free jazz festival on Grote Markt with performances by local and international artists
Warm summer days perfect for exploring outdoor attractions like Haarlemmerhout park
Pleasant late summer weather, smaller crowds than peak summer, perfect for sightseeing
Open Monument Days when historical buildings and sites normally closed to the public open their doors for visitors
Early autumn brings beautiful colors to city parks and gardens, comfortable temperatures for walking tours
Autumn colors peak in city parks and gardens, temperatures begin to cool
New cultural programs begin at Philharmonie Haarlem, Toneelschuur, and other venues; autumn exhibitions at museums
Quieter tourism period, increasingly cooler weather, transition to indoor activities and museums
Children's lantern processions and door-to-door singing in residential neighborhoods
Indoor cultural activities at museums and theaters, early preparation for holiday season
Traditional Dutch holiday celebration with Sinterklaas arriving by boat on the Spaarne River
Dutch pre-Christmas celebration with gift exchanges and special treats leading up to December 5th
Holiday markets at Grote Markt, festive decorations throughout the historic center, winter activities
Most businesses close by afternoon, special dining at hotels and restaurants, evening church services at St. Bavo's Church
Public holidays, most businesses closed, quiet atmosphere with limited dining options, beautiful winter ambiance in historic center
Post-Christmas period, winter festival continues, limited business hours, good time to explore museums
Citywide celebrations, fireworks displays, special events at Philharmonie and other venues throughout the city

summer: Rooftop Bars and Terraces in City Center
winter: Winter Menu Specialties at Local Restaurants
New Year's Celebrations at Grote Markt

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
